name: TheAtlantic
text:
.@BTS_twt are the first artists to land a Korean song at No. 1 on the Billboard Hot 100—and they did it without the help of U.S. radio.

@lenikacruz on why the Grammy-nominated pop septet’s hit single “Life Goes On” is resonating with millions: https://t.co/1HyO56KuGE

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The past few weeks have offered a preview of what Donald Trump’s post-presidency might look like: The president fulminates at length, playing pundit, but is a practical nonfactor in policy discussions," writes @GrahamDavidA: https://t.co/38TQRBlVIg

name: TheAtlantic
text: For four years, North Carolina has prohibited towns and cities from passing new protections for LGBTQ people. Today, that ban expires. But what comes next is uncertain, @giuliaheyward reports: https://t.co/SqSuhHyEKk

name: TheAtlantic
text: Looking at sparkly pictures from the Hubble space telescope might make some of us feel small—but that can be a good thing, @marinakoren writes. https://t.co/JdMyLrDpp0

name: TheAtlantic
text: "A vaccine is waiting on the other side of this pandemic winter. But before the temperature rises, and before the vials are distributed, Americans will have to find ways to remain safe inside, at home," @DKThomp writes: https://t.co/Egd4GFHuNv

name: TheAtlantic
text: The first two COVID-19 vaccine trials went pretty much perfectly. AstraZeneca's did not. Here's what to expect from forthcoming vaccine trials, from @sarahzhang: https://t.co/MOVqKlBYTK

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @elainejgodfrey: "Just as polls show Arizonans—especially those in the suburbs—souring on Trump, the state party has veered sharply to the right."

https://t.co/xIhgbQVwCQ https://t.co/F4Tw4jOKZb

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Trump’s veneer of invincibility is fading. He lost his bid for reelection, and staged the most incompetent coup attempt since Woody Allen’s 'Bananas,'" @Yascha_Mounk writes: https://t.co/YPTYEAeXNb
